revised_title: Catalogue of Fifty Plants Presented to the Royal Society by the Company of Apothecaries of London
tldr: The Company of Apothecaries of London presented a catalogue of fifty distinct plants to the Royal Society, as per the direction of Sir Hans Sloane. These plants were grown in their Physick-Garden, established in 1673, and the yearly presentation of fifty specimens was a condition of Sir Hans Sloane's generous grant of the garden to the company.
